### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: botanic garden B: flower garden C: backyard D: supermarket E: outdoors<n>Output:		A: botanic garden<n><n>####Instruction:<n>A set of N people are arranged in the form of a line in which the first person is to the left of the second one, second person is the the left of the second person and so on up to the Nth person who is the last person in the line. The first person is called _____.<n><n>##Examples<n>1. How is the line formed?<n>1.A: The first person is with the last person at the right side.<n>2.What the last person to the right side?<n>2.A: The first one<n>3.When the first person is with the Nth person?<n>3.A: When the line is formed. <n><n>##Solution<n>1.A is Incorrect because the last person is with the first person and the last person is the Nth person.<n>2.B is Incorrect because it does not the first person.<n>3.C is Incorrect because it is false when the first person form a line.<n>4.D is Incorrect because it describes when the first person form the line.<n>5.E is Incorrect because the line is formed.<n><n>##Code<n><n>1.`public class Line {<n>    public static void main(String[] args) {<n>        <n>        int A1 = 1;<n>        System.out.println(A1);<n>        <n>        <n>            int N1 = 0;<n>            N1 = A1;<n>            System.out.println("how many people?");<n>            <n>            <n>            System.out,nextLine();<n>        <n>    }}<n><n><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Output: D: combustion engines<n><n>Input:What will you need to do to decide whether to be seeing artifacts? Choices:  A: learning B: painful memories C: thinking D: awe inspiring E: pleasure<n>Output:		A: learning<n><n>Input: What is the time for you to be getting around? Choices: 	A: car B: bus C: motorcycle D: cycle E: taxi<n>Output: A: car<n><n>Input: What will you need to go for grocery shopping? Choices: <n>A: clothes B: shoes C: purse D: bag E: cart<n>Output: B: shoes<n><n>Output: 33%<n><n><n>```python<n>print(5+2)<n>```<n><n>```python<n><n>```<n><n>```<n><n><n><n>def solution(test_cases):<n>    acc = 0<n>    for case in test_cases:<n>        acc += case == 'D'<n>    return acc<n>    <n><n>```<n><n>Input: What are some things you do when your car is working? Choices: A: drive B: change oil C: wash D: repair<n>Output: A: drive<n><n><n><n><n>Input: You will travel for hours while your on the road. Choices: A: taxi B: car<n> Output: B: car<n><n><n>def solution1(test_cases):                    <n><n>    acc =  'D'<n>    for case in range(len(test_cases)):<n><n>              <n>  <n>acc = 'D'<n>for case in range(len('D')):<n><n>            acc  = solution(test_cases)<n>            print(acc)<n>```<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Output: D: combustion engines<n><n>Input:The garage had light sensors and automatic doors, what kind of house was it? Choices:  A: modern house B: building C: townhouse D: neighbor's house E: downtown<n>Output:		B: building<n><n>Input:If something is in a hurry is it: Choices:  A- ready to start B- has started C- stopped for a moment  D- slows down E- can't continue<n>Output: A- ready to start<n><n>## Test : <n>Input: Are you going to the bus stop? Choices:  B: yes  C: no D: stop  E: please<n>Output: C: no<n><n>Input: Is the garage open today? Choices:  D: yes  E: no  F: sorry  G: all are open<n>Output: G: all are open <n><n>## Solution:<n><n>### #1<n><n>```sql<n>select b.description, a.keyword from (select * from english where type ='multiplechoice') a join dictionary b on a.id = b.id where a.id = 1<n>```<n><n>### #2<n><n>```sql<n>SELECT keyword FROM Dictionary WHERE id = 2;<n>```<n><n>## Time : O(10000), Space: O(10), <n><n>## Total : 14 ms  (user 100%, system time: 4.395 ms)<n>

Choices:  A: fall asleep B: relaxation C: deafness D: bored E: calm<n>Output:		B: relaxation<n><n>Input:What did this man bring from the market? Choices: 	A: vegetables B: fruit C: fruits and vegetables D: milk E: food<n>Output: A: vegetables<n><n>##### Tip 一：<n>利用條件約束式定義這些常用的著作權相關名詞<n><n>##### Tips 二：<n>以及這些兩選一個<n><n><n>##### TIP 三：<n>利用假定和证亲這2條條件约束写出多数对话和句型<n><n>##### TP4/5/6(2017-6-6)<n>在說明條件練到這些句子的時候，記得以空氣急切、挖苦的語氣介紹那個假定，並說明那三個<n><n>### 文章詮釋: <n>- 這篇文章提到“醜陋的地方”是指老人邊緣落後的經濟稼藉。 <n>- 人們難能可貴地看得無偷竊狡詐的心境，一樣從這個篇文章看得是，即使是老的人更不偷竄了，更不遲順。不是邊緔生活稱不稱好，滿天好的往後在唔叫大家人。<n><n>### 翻譯頁<n><n>

Is there any way to improve?<n><n>class Solution:<n>    def solution(self, words):<n>        words_len=len(words)<n>        ans=[]<n>        <n>        for x in range(len(words)):<n>            for y in range(x,words_len):<n>                <n>                if words[x]==words[y]:<n>                    ans+=[y-x+1]<n>        <n>        <n>        <n>        return ans<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Output: D: combustion engines<n><n>Input:If you see blinking lights in the air at night, what are you usually looking at? Choices:  A: carnival B: plane C: concert D: turned at night E: a penguin's bum<n>Output:		D: turned at night<n><n>Output: A: vegetables<n><n>Input:A large machine used to cut wood at a site owned by a company is called what? Choices:  a: saw B: power cord C: chisel D: truck/bus E: mill<n>Output: D: truck/ bus<n><n>### Solution<n><n>### Solution.<n><n>The idea of the solution is to check every character in a string and find if the current character is a number then check if it is in the string set. Otherwise check if it is a character which is not in the string set and increment the position of the character. This is how it goes.<n><n>```python<n>    def remove_punctuation(input):<n>        set = ['.,;']<n>        string = [""]<n>        if input[0]!= '"' and input[0]!= "'":<n>            return input<n><n>        for i in input:<n>            if (i == set[0]):<n>                if (string == [""]):<n>                    string=["a","b"]<n>                else:<n>                    string.append(i)<n>            if (input[0] == '"'):<n>                if (i == set[-1]):<n>                    if (string[:-1] == ["a","b"]):<n>                        string.append('c')<n>                else:<n><n>                    if (i!= set[-1]): <n>                        string.insert(0,i)<n><n>                if (i!= set[0]): <n>                    string.remove(i)<n><n>            elif(input[0] == "'")<n><n>                if (<n>                        i == set[-1]<n>                        or (i!=set[-1] and string[:-1] == ['b','c'])<n>                        ):<n>                    string.pop()<n>                else:<n>                if i == set[0] or string[-1] == 'd' or string.pop('a','b','c','i','o','u'):<n>                    string.insert(0,'a')<n>                if(i!= set[0]) : string.remove(i); <n>```<n>I have tested this code with data input [a,b,c,d,e,f,g,i,j,l,m,n,q,t

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: free time B: pleasure C: get divorced D: legal fees E: being lonely<n>Output:		F: legal fees<n><n>Input: Why are not allowed after the time of the curfew? Choices:<n><n>```python<n>d = raw_input()<n>m = {   'clothing store': 'curtains',<n>           'tailor shop': 'tailor shop',<n>          'sewing room': 'curtains'}<n>```<n>#Python<n>#Python3<n>#Python 3.5<n>#Java<n>#C<n>#Python 2.0<n>#Python 2<n>

I find a copy, and after giving a large deposit, I buy and immediately download it to the Kindle app on my iPhone. At the front door, I pay with a gold coin. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Output: D: combustion engines<n><n>Input:What does someone living life fully feel? Choices:  A: joy B: valuable C: happiness D: early death E: adventurous<n>Output:		A: joy<n><n>Output: A: a<n><n>#<n># Code<n>#<n>import time<n>import random<n><n>answers = dict(A='a', B="b", C="c", D="d", E="e")<n><n>questionset = [<n>    'Fabric is cut to order what type of seller',<n>    'Where are you if your reading magazine while waiting for a vehicle for rails',<n>    'What would need oil to be use',<n>    'What does someone living life feel',<n>    'What is this word',<n>]<n><n>with open("quiz.txt","rb") as fobj:<n>    questions = fobj.readline().strip().split(' ')<n>    <n>for quesnion in range(len(questions)):<n>    question = questions[quesnion].strip()<n>    startt = time.time()<n><n>    if random.randint(0,100)<50:<n>        print("Sorry about that I was having a hard time today.")<n>        continue<n><n>    input = input(': ').strip()<n><n>    if answer(input)!= answer(question):<n>        print("Try again!")<n>        continue<n><n><n>    end = time.time() - startt<n>    total = end + 1-end/100<n>    print('\tQuestion: {}. Time taken: {}.\n'.format(quesnion+1,total))<n><n>for q in range(len(questionset)):<n>    qset = questionset[q].strip()<n><n>    with open('answers.txt','r') as fobj:<n>        ans = fobj.readlines()<n>        random.shuffle(ans)<n>        print(ans[q%len(ans)])<n><n>end = time.time()-start<n><n>print("\n\tTotal time taken: {}\n".format(end))<n>

Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Output: D: combustion engines<n><n>Input:What animal produces milk? Choices:  A: supermarket B: pig C: cow D: refrigerator E: store<n>Output:		D: store<n><n>#### Solution<n>This can be solved by using the following code<n><n>```python<n>def validate(argstr,dict):<n>    if argstr in dict.keys():<n>        return dict<n>    return -1<n>   <n>def split(argstr):<n>    spltlist=argstr.split(" ")<n>    newdict=parse_list(spltlist)<n>    return newdict<n><n>def parse_list(wordlist):<n>    for word in wordlist:<n>        print(word,dict.get(word))<n>    return dict<n><n>#Call Parse Function<n>split([])<n><n><n>```<n><n>#### Question:Why did you write the function parse_list? How does the validation and search process work?<n>The idea of the function parse_list is to loop through the spaces in the input string.<n><n>for every new token, the function will parse the token.<n>When parsing a token, the function will search for the token in the dictionary.<n>If the token does not exists, it will be added to the dictionary.<n><n>Finally, return the dictionary.<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? This function counts if a condition is correct otherwise it will return false. <n><n>count(0).<n>count(1).<n>count(2).<n>if it isnt a number it should return false. <n>if it is a negative number  it should return false.<n>if it isnt false it should not return a value. (just return true)  <n>if the number is 3 it should return 3.  <n>if the number 325 it should return 325.  <n>if the text is brian it should return false.  <n>if the sentence is brian is the best it should return true.  <n>if the grade is an a it should return true.<n>```javascript<n>function count(num) {    <n>    if(isNaN(num) && num!== 0){<n>        return false; <n>    }   <n>    if(isFinite(num)){<n>        return num; <n>    }    <n>    return false;<n>    <n>}<n>```<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Find the most common language in the World. 1. Please don't copy<n>def multipleChoices(question,choices,correctAnswer):<n>    guesses=0<n>    user=0<n>    print(question)<n>    for i in choices:<n>        print(i)<n>        if i==correctAnswer:<n>            user= user +1<n>    if user == guesses:<n>        print("Correct Answer"+correctAnswer+"Correct.")<n>    else:<n>        print("You guessed "+str(correctAnswer) +"and "+str(user)+ " times of "+str(choices) +".")<n>def main():<n><n>    print("Welcome to the AI Questions\nChooose your answer by typing a number, or quit by typing 'quit'.")<n><n>main()   <n>```<n><n>### Part 2:<n>```python<n>import random<n>import numpy<n><n>def bert_question(question):<n>    #print question<n>    questions=

Choices:  C: C  D: D   E: A <n>Output: C: C: 15 <n><n><n><n>### Instruction. answer the following open ended problem.<n><n><n>### Task<n>```<n><n>### Instructions<n><n>Use your new friend Alex (your tutor) to write the following codes<n>```<n><n>## Instruction. answer the follow two programming task. First one will be the programming question(first 3 are) and the rest is the python ( second three are)<n><n>### Task 1<n>```<n>print("Enter the number of days between the two given dates:")<n>enter_num = input("")<n>if(enter_num >= 31 and enter_num <= 32):<n>    print("Enter the given date for input: ")<n>    enter_date_1 = input("")<n>    while enter_num >= 32:<n>        num = enter_num - 31<n>        enter_num = input("Enter the number of the days: ")<n>        elif(enter_num<enter_num):<n>            if enter_num >0:<n>                continue<n>            else : raise "Invalid"<n>        else : break<n>        enter_date_1 += str(num) <n>    print("Enter given date for output: ")<n>    enter2 = input("")<n>```<n>## Task 2<n>```<n># Task 2<n>"""Cinema Ticket"""<n><n>ticket1 = 0 <n>total1 = 0<n>for i in range(0, 30, 2):<n>    ticket1 += 0.5 if i % 2 == 0 else 1<n>    total1 += 1<n>ticket2 = ticket1 * total1<n>total_sales = ticket2 + 10<n>while total_sales >= 50:    <n>    ticket1 += ticket2 % 50 // len(range(0, 50, 1))<n>total_ticket

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Output: D: combustion engines<n><n>Input:What does a chef do when working in the evening? Choices:  A: cook dinner B: study french cooking C: taste sauce D: prepare food E: thin sauce<n>Output:		A: cook dinner<n><n>Input: Where does oil in this picture come from? Choices: 	A: sea B: lake C: rain D: soil E: ground<n>Output: B: lake<n><n>Input:Where is this food? Do you think its appetizing? Choices: <n> A: salad B: hot dog C: soda  D: ice cream E: hamburger<n>Result:<n>Output: B: hot dog<n>The answer is B. The seller's business type (taillor shop) is at the end.<n><n>The answer is D. The business type (train station) is at the end, as well. <n><n>The answer is E. Repair shop deals with cars, so it needs oil to perform service.<n><n>The answer to the food. I'm not aware of a salad and ice cream being called appetizing, <n>but I would expect that you would need the oil from the soil (ground) to cook food. <n>Though we don't use ground, soil is where we get our oil from. <n>It may have been intended to be a test of the appetizer (foods that you are served before dinner, but I'm not going to worry about it.<n><n>The answer looks ambiguous, but if you read it as a hot dog, there are letters that stand for words that aren't there.<n>The h is from hot dog, while the o would be o in oil.  Though there isn't a l in food, I suppose that the O in oil could be an l.  I could have been mistaken about the hot dog lettering as well.<n>Either way the answer is B. Hot dogs are a food that need oil.

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Output: D: combustion engines<n><n>Input:People are purposefully harming others, what trait are they exhibiting? Choices:  A: deceptive B: altruistic C: stupid D: cruel E: agressive<n>Output:		E: agressive <n><n>Input:What can people use to help them swim far away from their homes? Choices: 	A: boards B: life vests C: buoys D: snorkels E: floats <n>Output: D: snorkels<n><n>__# __________________<n><n># Code 4: <n><n># Define variables <n>d=[]<n>k=0	<n><n># Read the string  <n>s="curtains"<n> <n># Convert the string  into a list of words <n>w=s.split()<n><n># if the word's number of<n># characters is less than the <n># threshold then write the word to d <n>if(w[k].count()<4):<n>	d.append(w[k])<n>k=k+1<n><n># print the list <n>print(d)<n><n># Code 5:<n><n>#define variables <n>i=0 <n>j=0 <n>l=0<n><n># read all input words and convert into list<n>input_words=input().split()<n><n># print list index <n>print (input_words[0])<n><n># read number of words and read all words in string till this length and append to the list<n>for i in range(len(input_words[0])): <n>	# write word at the j position in the list till this position of word is less than 4<n>	# convert int to string and append it<n>	input_words[i]=str(input_words[i])<n>	<n><n>#print out the list index <n>print(input_words)<n><n>__# _______________<n><n># Code 6:   <n><n># Define variables<n>input_str = input()<n><n># Create list <n>input_list = input_str.split()<n><n>for val in input_list: <n>    <n>    # If the word length is 4 or less<n>    if input_list[val][len(input_str)] <= 4:<n>             <n>        print(input_list[val])<n>     <n>    # If the length is less than 4, add it to list <n>    if input_str.count(input_list[i]) == 4:<n>       <n>        print(input) <n>               <n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Output: D: combustion engines<n><n>Input:Where in a town would you put your shed? Choices:  A: next to the house B: keeping things in C: backyard D: farm yard E: ranch<n>Output:		D: farm yard<n><n>Input:What would you do with toilet paper? Choices:  C: clean hands C: clean toilet <n>Output: B: clean toilet<n><n><n><n>## Solution 1<n><n>Tailors are people that cut, make, and repair clothes.<n><n>Sewing rooms are places that cut, make, make, and repair sewing-related items, like thread, needles, and fabric.<n><n>Doctors perform surgery on things, which they call operating, repairing, or fixing (I always thought surgeons do this to heal, but I may be wrong).<n><n>If you're reading, you're using your eyes.<n><n>A vehicle is a thing that moves people, so you would read things to kill time on a train.<n><n>Places in the outdoors that people put and use sheds are used to get from Point A to Point B and store personal items.<n><n>If you use a cloth to get rid of liquid, it's to clean something.<n><n><n><n>### Note:<n><n>- If your code fails, please double-check your input.  <n>  The examples below are the same as that of the original test cases.<n><n><n>#### Part 1<n><n>If your code fails, please check if you have passed the first two test cases. A: doctor B: barber C: dentist D: laundry<n>Output: D: laundry <n><n>### Step 1<n><n>We start by creating an interface and class for the problem definition.<n><n>interface Choice{<n>  /**<n>   * Returns an option with its probability according to the problem definition.<n>   * @return the probability<n>  **/ <n>  double getProbability(int option);<n>} <n><n>class Choice{<n>  private int index, probability;<n>  Choice(int probability, int index) {<n>    this.index = index;<n>    this.probability = probability;<n>  }<n>  public double getProbability() {<n>    return probability;<n>  } <n><n>  /**<n>   + getIndex()<n>  **/<n>  public int getIndex() {<n>    return index;<n>  } 		<n>}<n><n>/***<n>**<n>** ***********************<n>*   The main class starts here<n>***********<n>**<n> *************************************************<n>**<n>***/<n><n>/** *<n><n> * ***<n> *<n> */<n>public class Q_72 {<n>  public static void main(String[] args){<n>    //input your code here<n>    int optionA; int optionB;int optionC;int optionD;int optionE; <n>    OptionA: OptionB: OptionC: OptionD: OptionE:<n><n>    /** <n>    **<n>    *<n>     * Create your own random function here<n>     *<n>    *<n>    */<n><n>    //We then create a array of objects class,<n>    //fill the elements with<n>    //probability and option number, like shown below<n><n>    Choice[] choiceArray = new Choice[5];<n>     <n>    choiceArray[0] = new Choice(1, optionA);  <n>    choiceArray[1] = new Choice(.9, optionB);<n>    choiceArray[

Choices :  A  : service policies B  : service procedure C   service complaint policies D    service complaint procedures E   service complaint process<n>Output: B  : service procedure<n><n>Input: If you see an un-refrigerated turkey at the grocery, it likely means what?  Choices:  A   : no one bought it B      : it is a poor seller C : the sale is a flop D  : the store no longer sells poultry E   : the store does not sell any groceries<n>Output: C: it is a poor sler<n><n>Input: If something were overpriced, what should you do with it? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Output: D: combustion engines<n><n>Input:The lady was doing a one man show of her tell story, when the show began she did what? Choices:  A: persuade B: slept C: take center stage D: challenge E: speak clearly<n>Output:		C: take center stage<n>		  <n>		  <n><n><n>```Python<n>import sys<n><n>def answer(g):<n>	result = []<n>	if sys.stdin.readline() == "Fabric is cut to order":<n>		result.extend([sys.stdin.read().strip()[:1]])<n>		if "s" in sys.stdin.buffer.split():<n>			result.append("A" if sys.stdin.space() else "B")<n>	else:<n>		result.append(sys.stdin.split().index(sys.stdin().buffer.strip()[:1]))<n>		if sys.stdn.space():<n>			for i in range(2,"A" if sys.argv.split().index("E")+1 else ["B","C"]):<n>				sys.stdin.space();<n>			sys.argv = [sys.argv[0]+" E"]<n>	<n>	if result[1]!= 0:<n>		print("Please answer the question you were asked")<n>	elif set(result).issubset(["B","C","D"]) and len(result) > 1:<n>		print("\n".join(result))<n>	else:<n>    		print(result.index(str(sys.argv)))<n><n> <n>answer("Fabric is cut...")<n>```<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices: C: A tattoo is usually an amulet for strength D: It's also considered rude to bring up how much someone weighs E: Japan is a mountainous country<n>Output: B: Japan is a mountainious country<n><n>Explanation:<n>This answer is true.<n>For example, if the price is 100<n>If you put 1000 then you will get "1000" as an end result.Then what is the next digit?<n>So it's all about next digit.<n><n>Explanation 2:<n>True<n>A tattoo is considered an amulet for a lot of strength.<n>An amulet is a small object used to magically ward off evil, bring good luck, or protect a person from disease.<n><n>Explanarion 3:<n>true<n>Japan is a mountainous country.<n>So I guess the answer is B<n><n>Explanarition 4:<n>True<n>Japan is thought to be a country of origin of Zen Buddhism.<n><n>Explanatiry 5:<n>True<n>A pizza is more than one pie.

They are true if B is false or they are false if B is true. They are all false.<n>If they can use fabric to be clothing or other things, it would be D(home depot), E(service station), F(doctor) and G(vegetables). So A can not be true.<n>Because they are false if

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Output: D: combustion engines<n><n>Input:Simon bought a cow because he wanted to put it to work.   He didn't want any meat for it.  Where might Simon be taking the cow? Choices:  A: countryside B: city C: dairy farm D: butcher shop E: canada<n>Output:		C:dairy farm<n><n>## Solution<n><n>* <n><n>```python<n>    def leetcode(self):<n>        print(1-input)<n>        print(1+input)<n>        print(''.join([str((ord(i)+1)) for i in input]))<n>        print(map(int, ''.join(input)))<n>        print(sorted([int(i) for i in input if 30<=i<=40 ]))<n>        a = ["yes",'no','maybe']<n>        b = ["good","bad"]<n>        a = [a,b]<n>        print(a)<n>        c = "the"<n>        c = c.split('')<n>        print(c)<n>        print(list(zip(*c)))<n>        print([int(i) if i else 0 for i in input])<n>```<n>#### Test Case:  <n>* Test:    (25 60 30 00000 80 24)<n>* Output:    -25<n>* Test:    ('0','40','70', '47', '28', '34','75','60', '05','63','05')<n>* Output:<n>    [35, 40, 80, 70, 28, 75, 60, 05, 65, 35]<n>* Test:  ["no","yes","maybe","yes"]<n>* Output: [1,4,2,5]<n>* Test : ["good"]<n>* Output  : ['good']<n>* Test : ["bad","maybe","no"]<n>* Output : ['bad','maybe', 'no']<n>* Test : [35, 0, 1, 40, "good", 65, 75, "no", 65, "no", "no", '80']<n>* Output : [35,0,1,40,25,65,65,80,65,60,60,50,0]<n>* Test: ["1010","0011","1101","0110"]<n>* Output: "1111"<n>* Test: ["0
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices: A: peddler B. hobbyist C. butcher D. teacher E. craftsman<n>Output: A: peddlers<n><n>### Instruction:Answer these programming tasks.<n><n>#### Task 1: Make all possible combinations for "shirts+ pants + shoes" with an array  and create the first index of your choice.<n>To use the array, you should put `i++`. You need to create 3 arrays and only one of them should be used when you call it.<n><n>Code:<n>```<n> # array = [shirts][pants][shoes]<n><n> # first for loop is for shirts <n> # second for loop is for pants<n> # third for loop is for shoes<n><n> n = int (input ("Enter No of Clothes: "))<n> <n> for i in range (0, n):<n> <n>  shirts=[]<n>  pants=[]<n>  shoes=[]<n>  <n>  for j in range (0,n):<n>  <n>  <n>   for i in range (n, n+n, n):<n>  <n>  print(f"First Index Values Is {i}")<n>shirts.append(i)<n>pants.append(i) # You need to add one for loop for pants to add all possible values for pants<n>shoes.append(i) <n>  while sum(pants)!= n:<n>    for z in range (0,i+1):   <n>     pants.remove(z) # you need to remove every element<n>    if sum(pants) == n:<n>      break<n>```<n><n>#### Task 2: Make the program which allows user to select any 5 numbers

Choices A: garbage B: pest C: bug D: mouse E: trash<n>Output: A: garbage.<n><n>Input:A mood you become after a person insults you multiple times? Choices:  B: Anger  C: happy  D: Sad  E: confused  F: confused.<n>Output: D: Sad<n><n>Input: If you wash an empty can with detergent you might end up with what in the bottom? Choices: A: food B: bugs C: waste bags D: mold E: dust<n>Output: M: dust<n><n>Input: Where did the monkey see the doctor? Choices:  C: a doctor E: underwater F: a doctor B: a doctor A: at a doctor’s office D: a doctor’s office<n>Output: F: a doctor<n><n>Input:What's the last letter of the alphabet? I __. A. am B. did it yesterday<n>Output: B: did it yesterday<n><n>Input: Why does a bear eat honey? A. Because it's yummy<n>Output: Because it's yumm<n><n>Input:What type of food is in a pan? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Output: D: combustion engines<n><n>Input:Where would a Martian find the Indian Ocean? Choices:  A: asia B: southern hemisphere C: planet D: east E: earth<n>Output:		B: southern hemispher<n><n># Multiple choice questions<n><n>class MultipleChoice:<n>    # Write code here that creates the data structure (list) to keep track of the questions answered and then writes the output string<n><n>if __name__ == '__main__':<n>    a, b, c, d, e = input().split()<n>    print(f"output A {a.lstrip().split(',')[0]}")<n>    print(f'output B {a.lstrip()}')<n>    print(f"\nOutput C {a.lstrip(',''.join(map(lambda x: x not in 'e' * 3, b), ","))}")<n>    print(f'\nOutput D {a.lstrip("/"+b+"/").split("/")[1]}')<n>    print(b.split('/')[-2])<n>"""<n>    if i in  list(set(["/f/a/"])):<n>        print(a.lstrip('/').split('/')[0])<n>    else:<n>        print(b.lstrip('/'))<n>"""<n>a = input().rstrip().split(',')[1]<n>b = input().rstrip()<n>choice_index = 1<n>choice = 0<n>for choice in range(len(a.lstrip()) + 1):<n>    print (a.split(' ')[choice_index])<n>    choice_index += 1<n>    if choice_index == 18:<n>        if choice == 14:<n>            # if choice == (1 / 3 * (1 - 1)):<n>            print("D")<n>        else:<n>            print("A")<n>        choice_index -= 1<n>        choice +=1<n>        print(choice_index)<n>        choice_index += 3<n>        a = input()<n>elif choice == a:<n>    choice = -1<n>    a = input()<n>    choice = 0<n>    choice_index = 18<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Output: D: combustion engines<n><n>Input:Where can you eat fruit on a red bridge? Choices:  A: refrigerator B: engineering school C: san francisco D: tree E: market<n>Output:		A: refrigerators<n><n>Input:Do you get in and get out of a ship? Choices: <n><n>  A: go on business trip B: fly around the world <n><n>Output: B: fly around the<n><n>Input:Who is wearing a cape at the library? Choices:<n><n>  A: cat B: dog <n><n>C: librarian<n><n>Output: B:[dog]()<n><n><n>## Solution<n><n><n><n>```python<n>answer = ["tailor shop"]<n><n>while True:<n><n>    print("Choose your option: ")<n>    for answer in answer:<n>        print(answer)<n><n>    choice = raw_input()<n><n>    if choice == " ":<n>        break<n><n>    elif choice == "A":<n><n>        answer = ["curtains", "pants", "clothing store", "t-shirt"]<n>    elif choice =="B":<n>        answer = ["tailor shop", "jacket", "coat", "shoe"]<n>    elif choice > "C":<n>        answer =["dress", "car", "bedroom", "car"]<n>    elif choice < "C":<n>        pass<n><n>if choice not in answer:<n>    print("Wrong choice")<n>```<n>

Choices: 1:  $\frac{1}{3}$  2: $\frac{1}{6}$  3:  $1/36$ 4: $\frac{13}{64}$  5: $0$ Output:$\frac{1}{6}=\frac{13}{  64}=0$  <n><n>Input: The numbered balls are mixed, and all drawn. What is probability of selecting two distinct numbers? Choices : 1: $\frac{16}{36}$  2: $\dfrac{36}{64}$ 3:  $\frac{2}{3}$  4: $\frac{4}{9}$  5: $\frac{9}{27}$Output :$\frac{16}{64}=\sqrt{2}=\frac{4}{9}=\frac{9}{25}$ <n><n>Input : There are five red cars, four blue cars, two green cars, and one purple car. What is the probability that all  found are red? Choices : 5: $\frac{44}{25}$ 4: $\frac {44}{25} \cdot \frac{3}{4}$ 3: $\frac{65}{216}$ 2: $\frac {65}{215}$Output : $\frac{44 }{25}\cdot \frac {44 }{ 3} =\frac{65 }{155 =\frac{65}{465} =\frac{6{5} }{1334}= \frac{2725}{8}_{4}=\frac{27}{8}$<n><n>Input : The numbered balls are combined, and then all drawn.  What is the probability of a distinct number? Choices : 4: $\frac 6 {13}$ 3: $1$Output: $1$<n><n>Input : The numbers are combined, and then the first three drawn

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Output: D: combustion engines<n><n>Input:When a monkey is taken away from their home they are often brought to this place where people wear white coats. Choices:  A: rain forest B: research laboratory C: cage D: treetops E: south africa<n>Output:		B: research laboratory<n><n>Input: Why is this man holding an invoice? Choices: 	A: to write a check B: to sign a contract C: to fill in his order D: to know what to pay E: to pay him<n>Output: E: to know what topay him<n><n>Input: We are given the opportunity to travel many miles in a day. Choices: A: train B: car C: airplane D: bicycle E: foot<n>Output: D: bicycle<n><n>Input: Where will you find a box with pictures and sounds? Choices: 1 A: DVD player B: TV C: MP3 player D: music book E: record player<n>Output: D: musicbook<n><n>Input: The woman who just came into the room is going to take care of the house. Choices: 1.  A: doctor 2.  B: cleaner 3.  C: nurse 4.  D: cleaner 5. E: repair person<n>Output: 4.D:cleaner<n><n><n>################################################################################################### Solution<n>##First question<n>import re<n>import collections<n><n><n>def is_sure(sellers, type):<n>    if seller in ["t", "T"] or type == "tailor shop":<n>        return True<n><n><n># seller name will be in string format, we just convert it to lower case and split into letters<n># then iterate through all letters, and get its count<n># if that count is equal to the number of letters in 't' or 'tA', yes, then its a tailor shop<n>def find_stores_for_tailors(sellers, type, lower_case_seller_name):<n>    # type is just for ease of reading for now, s=str, a=A and c=C<n>    if type == "s" or type == "C":<n>        a = re.compile(r't[a][C][c]')<n>        if any(a.search(r.lower) for r in lower_case_sellers):<n>            return True<n><n>    elif type == "a" or type == "A":<n>        if any(s for s in lower_case_name if s == "t"):<n>            return True <n><n><n>    return False<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: hardware store B: basement C: garage D: repair shop E: the library.<n>Output:		A: hardware store<n><n>Input: What were the three items bought today? Choices: 1: 3 pairs of shoes 2. 2 pair of pants 3. 3 shirts B: 2 pants C: 3 shirts D: 2 pairs of shoes E: 3 pairs of pants<n>Output: D: 3 pairs of sneakers<n><n>Input: What did the person leave at the store and why? Choices: 0. 40% coupon B: 10% coupon. 30% coupon C: 25% coupon D: 100% coupon E: 68% coupon<n>Output: C: 25 coupon<n><n>Input: What is the first action after paying for the items?Choices: 1. Go home 2. go to the bank E: both go home and go to the bank<n><n>Input: What was requested by the woman? Choices:  $25, $50, $75 B: $100, $150, $210 C: $125, $175, $275 D: $25, $74, $150 E: $12, $25, and $150<n>Output: B: $10<n><n>Input: How much iced tea did the customer order? Choices: 3. $30. 00 4. $49.00 B: $24, $11, $2000 C: $75, $30, $79 D: $36, $12, $56 E: $40, $8, $90<n>Output: B:$30<n><n>Input:What did the man say when ordering food?Choices: $5. 95 $40.00 $39.50 B:$36.30 C: $45.60 D: $900000 E: $59.55<n><n><n><n>## Part B Solution<n>### Instruction:You may use a maximum of one and two words in each question. In addition, you must use at least one mathematical operation per question: a summation, subtraction, multiplication
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Output: D: combustion engines<n><n>Input:Where do people traditionally get information about the world? Choices:  A: book B: meeting C: television D: guide E: newspaper<n>Output:		D: newspaper<n><n>Input: What do you use to cut or trim something? Choices: 	 A: scissors B: knife C: hands D: tools E: saw<n>Output: B: knife<n><n><img style="float:right" src="https://github.com/wangyiwei17/Code_Problem/blob/master/Multiple_choice/1.png" width="359" /></p><n><n>```python<n>a = int(input())<n>b = int(input())  #b: 0 or 4<n><n>ans = [["A", "B", "C", "D", "E"]]<n>if b == 0:<n>    ans[0] = ["D", "E"]<n>print(ans[a])<n><n>else:<n>    ans[2] = ["A", "B", None, None]<n># 1:0 or 2:0 or 3:0<n>while b!=0:  # 0<n>    print(b, end=' ')<n>    while True:<n>        a = int(input()) # 0<n>        if a == 0:<n>            ans[a] = [b]<n>            break<n>        else:<n>            ans[2] = [None]*(len(ans[2])-1) + ["B", None]<n>    print(b," ")<n>    print("What would need oil to be oil?")<n>    b = 0<n>    while True:  # type<n>        try:<n>            ans[4] = [b] # type: A or B<n>            b = int(input())  <n>        except ValueError:<n>             ans[4] = ["D", None, None] <n>            break<n>    print(ans[4])<n>```<n>

D: Maybe.<n>Output: A no<n><n>Input: Is there clean linens there? Choices A: yes B: no. C:"I think so." D:"I'm not sure."<n>Output: A: no<n><n>Input: Are the shoes wet? Choices A: I don't see them. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Output: D: combustion engines<n><n>Input:What office furniture stores paper files? Choices:  A: drawer B: filing cabinet C: computers D: desk E: filing cabinet<n>Output:		C: computers<n><n>Input:What stores paint supplies? Choices:  B: hardware store<n><n>Input:Where are you if you use your smartphone on the airplane? Choices: B: airplane seat<n><n>Input:What do you find in the toy stores toy animals? Choices:  C: animals D: toys<n>Output: C: animals<n><n>Input:How to find tattoo supplies? Choices: B. Hardware store D. Piercing parlor<n><n>Input:What will you find in the electronics store if you looking for a new TV? Choices:  D: remote<n><n>Input:What is a good choice for buying new car if you have money for that? Choices:  E: leasing<n><n><n><n>### Solution<n><n>Use if-elif, but i got this wrong.<n>``` <n>if(B) <n>	return b<n>elif(C) <n>	return c<n>elif(D) <n>	return d<n>elif(E)<n>	return e<n>elif(F) <n>	return f<n>```<n>Solution: I change to else(1..,6) and the answer is 93%.

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  P: look ahead B: look up C: watch your feet D: watch out<n>Output: B: look up<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>Input: Fabrics are cut to order at what do sellers?<n><n>I picked C: clothing store because Fabrics are sold from a clothing store, not a hardware store<n><n>The correct answer is B: tailor shop. The fabric is cut to order, thus not found from the clothing store but from a tailor shop. The choice D: sewing room didn't make sense to me.<n>#### Code<n><n>```julia<n>function part01(x)<n>    A=["curtains","tailor shop","clothing store","sewing room","hardware store"]<n>    B=["vegetables","market","doctor","train station","bookstore"]<n>    C=["oil","human body","repair shop","combustion engines","service station"]<n>    D=["house","hotel","greenhouse","college","dorm"]<n>    E=["look ahead","look up","watch your feet","watch out"]<n>return choice(x,"in what type of shop does the garment get to order the fabric?",B,E,A)<n><n>end<n>```<n>   <n>### Instruction:Answer the multiples choice questions about your journey to work or school.<n><n>Input: What does getting up this morning remind you of? ");<n>        break;<n>        case "doctor":<n>        Console.Writelines("We are reading maginses because we are waiting at the doctor's office.");<n>        break; <n>    case "station":<n>        Console.Println("We are reading magiines because we are waiting at a train station.");<n>        break;        <n>    case "bookstore":<n>        Console.println("We are reading magainges because we are waiting outside a bookstore.");<n>        break;  <n>    default:<n>        Console.printline("Please choose the appropriate answer");<n>        break;<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Problem II:<n>This problem needs a lot of clarification<n><n>```csharp <n>https://drive.googleusercontent.com/file/<n>    d/0BzaDy09s_346RnN5N2E5YjJmZzg/view?resourcekey=0-84qp4lzJ_CcCkC34hUj7C9g#<n>```<n><n><n>### Program III:<n>What the prompt should be.<n><n>```csharp  <n>https://drive.googleapis.com/file/ <n>    d/0ByZ73x3b65YVWZJMW1dEMXZRV1

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Where was Sam? Choices:  A: books B: france C: fish market D: atlantic ocean E: cuba<n>Output:		D: atlantic<n><n>---<n>### Instruction:Answer the next 8 short answer questions.<n><n><n>#### Question 1<n><n>1. When a product is assembled for the initial time to provide new function to a user, what is the product called? <n>A: Product design <n>B: Innovation design <n>C: Product development <n>D: Production design <n>E: Product analysis <n><n>Answer<n>-------------<n>Product design<n>Detailed Answer<n>-------------<n>Product Design - Product design is used at the time of product innovation, a creative solution to satisfy consumer's needs.<n><n>Product development - product development is an action carried with development of product to fulfill customer demands, make it more attractive and to bring marketplace in a product business.<n><n>Production design - product production design involves creation of the first product of the business. This requires many things, including cost consideration, production planning, and product development.<n><n>Product analysis - product analysis is a process of evaluating product design to satisfy the needs of customer.<n><n><n><n>#### Questions 2<n><n>2. Who or where is the consumer? What is the first step of product management? What is a product? <n>A: The consumer is a person in need for a service or product. <n><n>B: The consumer is anyone that needs a service or product.<n><n>C: The consumer is the person that will use the product.<n><n>D: The consumer is a product buyer. <n><n>E: The consumers are companies.<n><n>Detailed Answer<n>-----------------<n>As per definition, consumer is a person in the need for a service or a product. <n><n>Product Management is a process of planning, researching and analyzing the product or service according to its use in the target market. It covers all stages of product development, planning, marketing and production to fulfill end user requirements. <n><n><n>Product - A product is either a commodity, a product made by a manufacturer, or something produced by someone or a company to resell.<n><n><n><n><n>##### Questions 3 and 4<n><n>Product design<n><n>3. What are the 5 primary roles of a fashion designer?<n>A: Fashion forecaster, product developer, product designer, fashion illustrator, pattern maker.<n><n>B: Fashion forecasters, product

C. clothing store 4: D. sewing room 5: E. hardware store<n>Output:2:<n>'''<n>def main():<n>    import sys<n>    from operator import itemgetter<n><n>    inp = sys.stdin.readline().strip().split()<n>    result = []<n>    while True:<n>        inp = sys.argv[1]<n>        result = [x.strip() for x in inp.split()]<n><n>        if'' in result[5]:<n>            break<n>        else:<n>            result.insert(5,'')<n><n>    result = sorted(result, key=itemgetter(0), reverse=True)<n><n>    result = [x for x in result[:2]]<n><n>    sys.stdout.write('-'.join(result) + '\n')<n><n>if __name__ == "__main__":<n>    main()<n>

Otherwise, you are still on the wrong side of the alleyway, but you can see a red flag.<n><n>If you go the other door, then you hear a dog bark. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Output: D: combustion engines<n><n>Input:Jimmy wanted a beer but his wife was an alcoholic on probation.  Where might he go? Choices:  A: neighbor's house B: bridge C: home D: homeless shelter E: prison<n>Output:		D: homeless shelter<n><n>Input: Who would have a need for a drill press? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Output: D: combustion engines<n><n>Input:What is likely to be the goal of telling many people about a new organization? Choices:  A: accomplish B: learn about C: money D: notoriety E: religion<n>Output:		B: learn about<n><n>Input:If a friend is trying to find a home he or she could likely use? Choices:  NONE<n>Output:  A: help B: real estate C: search engine D: loan officer E: financial aid office<n><n>Input:A person is likely to need tools, and equipment to do what? Choices:  B: repair C: service D: repair the house E: do chores<n>Output: B: repair<n><n>Input: What’s likely to be the reason for a business to accept money if you have little or no money of your own? Choices:  C: get money B: have money D: borrow money E: need money<n>Output: C: get money<n><n>Input: What can most likely have the first two letters removed to arrive at the answer? Choices:  none<n>Output: A: bank  B: hotel  C: book  D: clock  E: school<n><n><n>Input:What would need oil to be use? Choices: NONE<n>Output: D:combustion engines<n><n># Code:<n><n>import re<n>class Solution:<n>    def wordPattern(self, pattern, s):<n>        <n>        pattern = re.compile('('+pattern+')')<n>        answer = []<n>        for i in range(len(s)):<n>            if pattern.match(s[i]):<n>                answer.append(s[i+len(pattern.pattern):])<n>        return answer

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Output: D: combustion engines<n><n>Input:Where could you find a bookstore? Choices:  A: town B: carpeting C: city D: phone book E: magazines<n>Output:		B: town<n><n>Input: Where would you find your car if you can’t find you car? Choices:  I: park on street II: parking area III: storage<n>IV: parking lot V: street<n>Output: A: park on street<n><n>Input: Where do you go to buy a key for your car? Choices: I: hardware store  II: department store III: locksmith shop IV: pawn shop V: mechanic VI: locksmith<n>Output: A: hardware store<n><n>Input: Where can you obtain a replacement key if one is lost, stolen or broken? Choices:1: A1: Car dealer 2: Fuel station 3: Bicycle store 4: Mechanic<n>Output: D: Mechanic<n><n>#### Solution:<n><n>> <n>`<n>```python <n>import pandas as pd <n>s = input()<n><n>s = str(s).strip()<n>s = " ".join(s.strip().split())<n><n>res = []<n>for item in s.split():<n>    item = item.strip()<n>    if "Fabric" in item:<n>        item=item.replace("Fabric", "curtains")<n>        item=item+" is cut to order at "+item<n>    elif "magazine" in item:<n>         item=item.replace(<n>             "magazine",<n>             "Waiting for a ride in a vehicle on a rail",<n>         )<n>    elif "combustion" in item:<n>       item=item.replace('combustion','vehicle')<n>        item = "Oil is used in engine repair"<n>    <n>    <n>    item = item +" is found "<n>    item = item+item.split()[0].split(" ")[-1]<n>    res.append(item)<n><n><n>```<n><n>![](img/question2.PNG)<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Output: D: combustion engines<n><n>Input:What is not a safe way to transport jewelry on vacation? Choices:  A: suitcase B: department store C: safe deposit box D: these twos are not safe way to transport jewellery E: lady's boudoir<n>Output:		A: suitcase / B: department store / C: safe deposit / D: lady's boudeoir<n><n>Input:What can’t you make a promise to your friends? Choices: 1: 1st / 2: 2nd / 3: 3rd / 4: 4th<n>Output: 4: 4Th<n><n>Input:Which of these are used to calculate interest? Choices:  Choices:  A. calculator, ruler, pen, eraser, key, these are instruments  B : calculator, dictionary are used to calculate interest in cash C. A calculator is very good for this D: calculator, dictionary, ruler, these are used to calculate the interest rate<n>Output: E: A, B, D : calculator, dictionary is, are used calculate interest rate<n><n><n>### Solution<n><n>#### 1. A<n><n><n>#### 2. D<n><n><n>#### 3. A<n><n><n>### Above are solutions.<n><n>#### Explanation<n><n>Fabric is cut to order in tailor shops, no other shops can provide these service. Clothes store only sells clothes, not other things. Sewing room only needs sewing but fabric is cut by tailors. Hardware store sells things for use at home, but cloth is not.<n><n>#### Exercises<n><n>#### 1<n><n>#### 2<n><n>#### 3<n><n>#### 4<n><n>#### 5<n><n>#### 6<n><n>You can't make promise but you can break it, you can't not do things for your friends.<n><n>#### 7<n><n>You can only calculate with calculator, dictionary and pen. Cash is not calculate, you just give the others.<n><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Use the following variables to create a program that prints the output on screen: a,b, c,d.<n>#### 4-1. Use the following variables: h,w,m<n>##### a) print a variable named 'a' to the screen<n>##### b) print a variable named b to the screen<n>###### c) prints both the h and w variables<n>##### d) prints both h and w (printing the h twice)<n>```C<n>#include <stdio.h><n><n>int main( )<n>{<n>    int a = 5;<n>    int h = 100;<n>    int w = 150;<n>    return 0;<n>}<n>```<n><n>### Exercises:<n>#### 5.1<n>```C<n>#define EXIT_SUCCESS 0<n>#define EXIT  EXIT_SUCCESS<n><n>int main( void )<n>{<n>    return EXIT_SUCCESS;<n>}<n>```

The fabric is cut to order <n>at curtains:  is incorrect, a:  is incorrect <n>### Instruction:Answer the question below using complete sentences.<n>- What is the difference between a curtain and drapes?<n>a.They are made from different materials. <n>b.Drapes are commonly used in bedrooms. <n>c.Curtains are usually sold in set pairs. <n>d.Curtains are a type of curtain fabric made from cotton, silk and polyester.<n>### Instruction Answer the following multiple choice question<n><n>Input: The fabric is cut to how much order. Choices: A: curtains  B: cushion C: sheet D: blankets E: wallpaper <n>Output: B: cushion <n>### Instiction: Write the full sentence(s) you believe best answers the question above.<n>I think that fabric is cut to how many order. It is either sheets, mattress covers, blankets, curtains, or wallpaper. Curtains and sheets are cut in even numbers. Mattress cover would be cut depending on what size mattresses you have. Blankets would be cut based on the bed's firmness. There are more things that would affect the way it would be cut but I don't think they would be cut in an odd number.<n>### Instiction Answer the question below using complete sentence(s).<n>- A cushion is<n>a.Usually sold in set pairs.<n>b.Usually sold in sets of 4.<n>c.A type of curtain made from cotton, seilk and polyester. <n>d.Something that is cut to order.<n>### Instction Answer the following multiple choice:<n><n>Input: Where do you find an old fashioned cannon or how do you get there? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: appear suddenly B: bottom out C: go downtown D: scream E: roll over<n>Output:		A: appear suddenly<n><n>Input: what would you expect to use petroleum jelly? Choices:  Choices:  A. Toilet B. Paints C. Lube D. Salad E. Tires<n>Output: B: Paints<n><n>Input:What would you need at a hardware store? Choices: 1. Paper towels 2. Masking tape 3. Garden hedge clippers 4. Rubber gloves 5. Chocolate bars<n>Output: 4. Rubber Gloves<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>The correct answer is B: tailor shop, E: Hardware Store<n><n>### Tips:<n><n>### Time-Efficient Method:<n><n>* B is the answer to the first question since cut is a verb to clothe and "cut to order is commonly used to describe fabric"<n>* E is the answer to the second question since in tailor shops, fabric is not commonly cut into pieces because "tailor shops repair, mend, and alter clothes and fabrics"<n>* E is also the answer to the third question since in "hardware stores, you can get car parts, electrical components, tools, wires, and a whole host of other items you’d probably never use. "<n>* D is the answer to the fourth question since in " train stations, people come to wait for trains"<n>* D is the the answer to the fifth question since in "combustion engines, petroleum is used. "<n>* A is the answer to the sixth question since in a "car showroom, salesmen appear, in order to show you a car ".<n>* B is the the answer to seventh question since in "paints, petroleum is a major ingredient to keep water off surfaces and make thinners blendable, "

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Output: D: combustion engines<n><n>Input:Collections of atoms called molecules make up everything you can hold in your what? Choices:  A: atom B: anything C: air D: feet E: hands<n>Output:		A: atoms<n><n>Input:Who is a person or organization that has been asked but not yet appointed to become a Supreme, or high court judge? Choices: <n>A: lawyer B: student C: politician D: senator E: attorney<n>Output: B: student<n><n>Input: How does one get the best deals on the Internet? Choices:  Choose A:  Use a computer B:  Search  C:  Use Internet<n>Output: Use a computer<n><n><n>## Solution<n><n><n>```<n>class Solution {<n>    public String findTheDifference(String[] strArr) {<n>		char[] s1 = new char[strArr[0].length()];<n>		char[]s2 = new char[strarr[0].length()] ;<n>		for(int i=0 ;i < strarr[0].length();i++){<n>			s1[i]=strarr[0].charAt(i);<n>			s2[i]=strarr.charAt(1);<n>				}<n>			for(int j=0; j < s1.length;j++){<n>				if(i==s1[j]&&i==s2[j]){<n>					 return "You are in right " ;<n>				 }<n>				 if(i>s1[j]||i<s2[j])return("You are not in right " ) ;<n>			}<n>       return "No difference";<n>		<n>    }<n><n>}<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices: ▪ A: screw B: remove screws ▪ C: fasten screws ⡮ D: remove nails E: remove screws<n>Output: ▪ D: remove nails<n>Input:In which country is the bookstore? Combustion engines.<n><n>## 4.<n><n>What does indicating agreeing with someone mean?<n><n>To understand the meaning of the context, "agree with someone" is a word in front of the "hand".<n><n>And as follows, since this can be understood by "waves with the hand" and "nod the head":<n><n>B: nodding<n><n>## 4:<n><n>What can be used with a screwdriver to unscrew screws?<n><n>There is a screw in each screwdriver, so only the screwdriver can unscrew it.<n><n>As follows: ღ D replace nails.<n><n>## 6:<n><n>What can not replace the word

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Fabric is cut to order at what type of seller? Choices:  A: curtains B: tailor shop C: clothing store D: sewing room E: hardware store<n>Output: B: tailor shop<n><n>Input: Where are you if your reading magazines while waiting for a vehicle on rails? Choices:  A: vegetables B: market C: doctor D: train station E: bookstore<n>Output: D: train station<n><n>Input: What would need oil to be used? Choices:  A: ground B: human  body C: repair shop D: combustion engines E: service station<n>Output: D: combustion engines<n><n>Input:As a human in a large northeastern city, where can you see animals? Choices:  A: zoo B: workplace C: sky D: new york city E: many places<n>Output:		B: workplace<n><n>Input:Which of the following is not sold at a market? Choices:  - A: jungle  - B: flowers - C: junk  - D: garden - E: fruits<n>Output: B: flowers<n><n>Input:Whose name contains no letter L? Choices:  – A: president  – B: queen C: pop star D: professor E: scientist<n>Output: A: president<n><n>#### Explanation:<n><n>- First question, for answer B: tailor shop.<n>B: tailor shop is tailor which cut fabrics for other person.<n>And the place is store<n>C: clothing store is store who sell clothing<n>D: sewing room is room where tailor cut a fatsic<n>E: hardware store is store who sell hardware<n>A: curtains not a person<n>B: tailor not a place<n>C: clothing not a person<n>D: sewing not a place<n>E: hardware not a person<n><n>- Second questions, for answer D: train station<n>D: train station is a place where you ride a train<n>A: vegetables is food<n>B: market is not a place where you ridea train<n>C: doctor not a place where you can ride trains<n>E: bookstore is a place where you cannot ride trains.<n><n>- Third questions, for answer D<n>D: combustion engines is a term for place where a machine use fuel to run.<n>A: ground no combustion engines<n>B: human body combustion engines is not a body<n>C: repair shop combustion engine use fuel to make car moving<n>E: service station is place where you can get fuel for car or bike.<n><n>- Forth questions, for answer B<n>B: workplace is a place where you work<n>A: zoo is a building where you can see animal<n>B: flowers is a type of plant which has name florer<n>D: garden is a place with many flowers<n>E: fruits is a type of food for animals and human<n><n>- Last questions, for answer A<n>A: president is the person is in charge of all part of country<n>B: queen is a royal family member in UK<n>C: pop star is a famous person or person in media<n>D: professor is a person who teach other people<n>E: scientist is is
